item.title: Configuring the UART on PSoC

item.title: Drawing Software
item.description: What is drawing software used for? Drawing software is used to create diagrams for inclusion in presentations and reports.

item.title: Installing Cadence
item.description: Installation System Requirements PC: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, or greater (Hardware and Software Requirements) Mac: Windows 7, 8, 8.

item.title: Integrated Development Environments for PSoC
item.description: In order to program a Cypress Programmable System on a Chip (PSoC®), you first need to install Integrated Development Environment (IDE) software on your computer.

item.title: Interrupts
item.description: What is an interrupt? Consider the following knock-knock joke: Figure 1 Joker: “Knock, knock”

item.title: Software design
item.description: What is a finite state machine? A finite state machine (FSM) is a way of modeling a system such that there are a limited number of finite “states” that a system can be in, and that it can only be in one of those states at a time.

item.title: What is a Gantt Chart?
item.description: A Gantt Chart is a common project management tool that helps teams understand the phases of a project, deadlines, critical paths, and interdependencies between tasks.

item.title: What is Cadence?
item.description: Cadence is an electronic computer-aided drafting (ECAD) program commonly used in industry for the design and simulation of electronic circuits and printed circuit boards.
